author: jason.carver
content:
The ethereum/tests repo has the 2930 tests, which show a `type` field (since they are also 2718 transaction objects)
https://github.com/ethereum/tests/blob/50c90892caca32c7c942f91e882473be8387f6ce/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stEIP2930/addressOpcodes.json#L110-L131
It's not a proper spec of course, but it's a hint that `type` is a reasonable choice for a key name for a 2718 transaction in the json-rpc response.

author: yuga.eth
content: Thanks Jason, that's helpful! Of course, all of the transactions listed there are of type "0x01" (i.e. EIP-2930 transactions), so they don't necessarily tell us what a 1559 transaction will look like for the other fields, e.g. max_inclusion_fee

author: marekm3498
content:
<@!543900561460822016> <@!574864862338088960> Did you add the below checks to your clients? I think the comparison signs have the wrong direction in the specification, but I wonder what if parent_gas_used = 0?
        `assert block.gas_target <= parent_gas_target + parent_gas_target // 1024, 'invalid block: gas target increased too much'
        assert block.gas_target >= parent_gas_target - parent_gas_target // 1024, 'invalid block: gas target decreased too much'`
